plugins.name: Copy Colors
plugins.description:
Figma can swap fills and strokes. But what if you need both of them?


  1. Select some layers
  2. Choose destination (copy to stroke or to fill)
  3. Hit Enter


The plugin copies the content of fill and pastes it into stroke (and vice versa). Colors and styles are easy to copy manually. But the plugin will be useful if you have complex fill like gradients and images.


Made w/<3 by qurle

plugins.name: Numerator
plugins.description:
Easy way to numerate frames and pages (works in Figma Slides)

  1. Numerate using 2 flags: {current}, {total} and 8 direction modes: ‚Üë ‚Üó ‚Üí ‚Üò ‚Üì ‚Üô ‚Üê ‚Üñ
  2. {current} or short syntax {c} ‚Äì to place the current frame number
  3. {total} or short syntax {t} ‚Äì to place the number of all slides
  4. To use in page names, simply add flags to the page name


* You can use the flags {current} and {total} separately or together


How it works

  1. Only those objects in which either the frame name or the text layer content has the flags are considered.
  2. Supports multi-user operation. Flags are stored at the file level.
  3. To use in page names, simply add flags to the page name
  4. The plugin can be rerun if you change the sequence of frames or pages but do not modify the strings with flags that were replaced by the plugin.


Demonstration

https://youtu.be/bSdbrt5SuBM?feature=shared


Support

https://jamillazarev.gumroad.com/l/numerator

https://www.producthunt.com/products/numerator

accepted.name: Jamil Lazarev
accepted.description:
Dad, husband, manager, designer, mentor and sometimes developer.
9 pet-projects with 30k+ users: Figma, Amazon, TripAdvisor, SimilarWeb, Harvard University, etc

plugins.name: Tempo - AI-Powered Figma to Code (React)
plugins.description:
Convert Figma Designs into Seamless React Code with Tempo Labs


TL;DR: Tempo is an AI design & prototyping tool which contributes high-quality react code directly to your codebase. You can use tempo to generate complete views using simple AI prompts, polish & control design details visually, and build a high quality design system using your existing components. We built a plugin to bring Figma designs to Tempo.


Tempo Labs bridges the gap between design and development by migrating your Figma designs into clean, production-ready code effortlessly. Whether you're working on an existing project or starting fresh, Tempo Labs streamlines your workflow with intuitive tools and powerful AI-driven features.


Key Features

  1. No Setup: Your designs are automatically opened in an existing or new Tempo Labs project
  2. AI-Assisted Design Optimization Tempo optimizes and aligns layouts automatically during the conversion process.
  3. Retains Original Images and Designs Uses original images and designs.
  4. Select and Export Layers with Ease Choose any layer in Figma and export it directly to an existing or new project in Tempo Labs.
  5. Developer-Friendly Code Clean and readable code that's easy to edit, update, and integrate with your existing React project.
  6. Community and Support Share your experiences, ideas, and suggestions on Twitter or Reddit (@tempo_labs) and help us improve the tool continuously.
plugins.tagline: Migrate Figma designs to React in Tempo Labs' AI-powered editor and accelerate development

plugins.name: Export Figma Email Template to HTML - Postcards Email Builder
plugins.description:
Export a Figma email design to HTML without coding. By exporting the email template to Postcards email builder, you can download the template for free. Or, you can create a new email template directly in the Postcards.


Resources:

‚Ä¢Free email templates on Designmodo

‚Ä¢Free Figma email templates


Utilize the simple drag-and-drop interface provided by the Postcards to craft effective, visually appealing email campaigns without any coding skills required. Seamlessly integrate your Figma email designs, ensuring your email templates maintain a professional and consistent look across various platforms and devices. With Postcards, not only does your email template become highly customizable, but it also becomes incredibly user-friendly.


How Figma Email Template to HTML plugin works:

  1. Install the plugin
  2. In Figma select the art-board with your website
  3. Choose "Plugins" and click on Export Figma Email Template to HTML
  4. Pair the Postcards with Figma
  5. Export your email designs
  6. Download the email template ready-made to be send.


Features

  1. Efficiently create email designs with a wide array of pre-included components.
  2. Tailor text, imagery, styles, and auto-layout configurations using Postcards.
  3. Define responsive designs for mobile devices with ease.
  4. Directly inside Postcards, preview your authentic HTML email across various device dimensions.
  5. Compatibility with Google Fonts, featuring web-safe fallback options for clients that do not support them.
  6. Design and export HTML email signatures with simplicity.
  7. No coding skills necessary: produce and export responsive, ready-for-production HTML with a single click.
  8. Integrations available for various platforms including MailChimp, Klaviyo, SendGrid, Postmark, HubSpot, Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Pardot, ActiveCampaign, Braze, SendPulse, and Brevo (previously Sendinblue).
  9. Automatically produce a preview page featuring all your HTML emails.
  10. Download the exported .zip file directly to your computer from Postcards.


Video -> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Ecdsefa7xpI

accepted.name: Designmodo
accepted.description: Design Website & Email Templates.

plugins.tagline: Postcards email builder exports Figma email designs to HTML without requiring any coding.

plugins.name: FigDone
plugins.description:
A clean way for you and your team to keep design statuses visible, without cluttering your canvases with unnecessary components and stickers.


Get started in 3 steps

  2. Select the frame on the canvas or in the plugin
  3. Change the status


Custom status for paid subscribers


FigDone now has the ability for you to add custom statuses! Subscribe today and get access to:

  • Create new statuses
  • Change status colours
  • Select custom emojis
  • Rename and delete statuses


Get your subscription by clicking here!


Free features you'll love


  • Beautiful dark mode matches your Figma interface

  • Find a frame on the canvas by clicking its name in the plugin

plugins.name: TomTom Maps Generator
plugins.description:
Welcome to the official TomTom Maps Generator for Figma!


With the TomTom Maps Generator Plugin, you can easily integrate TomTom maps into your Figma designs.


From the TomTom styles gallery, you can choose a map style that best fits your style or you can customize a map to your specific requirements using the TomTom Map Maker and integrate it via this plugin into your Figma designs.


You‚Äôll find a set of default map styles tailored for various use cases:

  1. Street - Light: Ideal for browsing scenarios during the day or in light mode.
  2. Street - Dark: Best suited for browsing scenarios at night or in dark mode.
  3. Street Satellite: Use this aerial imagery map for browse or navigation use cases.
  4. Street Driving - Light: Perfect for navigation during the day or in light mode.
  5. Street Driving - Dark: Optimal for navigation at night or in dark mode.
  6. Mono - Light: Great for showcasing data, such as heat-maps or clusters.
  7. Mono - Dark: Optimised to show data on top of a dark monochromatic map.
  8. Wireframe: The map style to use by interaction designers working on UX/UI concepts.


Each style allows you to enable additional information via layers, like traffic flow, traffic incidents, points of interest (POIs), but also the base layers like water and roads.


Need a unique map style? No problem! Visit the TomTom Map Maker tool to customize the look and feel of your map. Generate a style URL in the Share view, and seamlessly use the map in your Figma designs within this plugin.


How to use the plugin?


To use the plugin, select a shape, layer, or frame and run the TomTom Maps Generator plugin. Within the plugin interface, choose the location, camera view, map style, select the layers and click Generate map. The map is now visible in your designs.


The state of the map is saved to the shape, enabling you to update the map by selecting of the shape and rerunning the plugin.


Copyright attribution


You must attribute Open Street Map in derived work that features a visible map.


For more details, see the OSM license text. Specific examples can be found in the Attribution Guidelines.



¬© 2024 TomTom. All rights reserved.

accepted.name: TomTom
accepted.description: The official home of TomTom‚Äôs design resources, plug-ins and templates.

plugins.tagline: Add a map into your Figma designs fast and easy

plugins.name: Noise
plugins.description:
Add Realism with Noise in Figma!


Noise is the perfect companion when you want to introduce texture, depth, and a touch of realism to your Figma designs. Whether you're looking to mask banding in gradients or add intricate textures, this plugin offers an array of customizable features to help you achieve professional-grade effects.


Adjust the noise to simulate various textures, from soft clouds to hard edges. Stretch it for a brushed metal effect, smooth it to create subtle wear, or add a vignette to enhance the density towards the edges. With complete control over color and blending modes, you can fine-tune the noise to seamlessly blend into your design.


Features

  1. Auto Size Detection ‚Äì Automatically detects the size of the selected frame or shape in Figma, ensuring the noise texture fits perfectly without manual adjustments.
  2. Color Customization ‚Äì Use the built-in color picker or hex values to control the hue of the noise, allowing for a tailored texturing effect that complements your design.
  3. Density Control ‚Äì Adjust the density slider to influence the intensity of the noise, from subtle grain to bold textures.
  4. Depth Control ‚Äì Modify the depth slider to control the number of shades used, ranging from sharp 1-bit noise to intricate 256 shades for a refined look.
  5. Stretch Slider ‚Äì Create brushed textures or grain effects by stretching the noise pattern horizontally or vertically to fit your design needs.
  6. Smoothness Adjustment ‚Äì Generate organic textures like clouds, wear, or smudges by adjusting the smoothing slider to refine the noise texture.
  7. Vignette Effect ‚Äì Apply a vignette effect to concentrate noise around the edges, adding a natural, focused texture to your designs.
  8. Instant Application ‚Äì Quickly apply noise as an image fill on the selected object in Figma, streamlining your design workflow.


Elevate your designs with Noise in Figma‚Äîit's the ultimate tool to add texture and character to your creative work, effortlessly.
plugins.tagline: Noise Texture Generation for Pixel-Perfect Figma Designs.

plugins.name: Apply variables
plugins.description:
Already have your variables set up and want to bulk apply them to your work? You can swap styles with variables or apply variables that match raw number values to elements in any file with access to your variables collections! 


Watch a demo video of the plug-in in action here.


Swap with variables by name

  1. Example: elements with color style background/default applied to them will have the variable called background/default applied to them after the plug-in works its magic. 
  2. Reads names from applied color styles or applied variables and lets you swap that with a variable of a given collection with the same name
  3. Currently available for color variables.


Apply matching variables (autofix) to radius or AutoLayout dimension properties

  1. Example: you have a variable called container-radius/default with a value of 8. After the plugin runs, all containers with 8 as their corner radius would have the container-radius/default variable applied. 
  2. Currently available for number variables (corner radius, item spacing, padding and row gap).
  3. If there are several variables with the same value, it chooses the first variable with the same scope settings as the property would need. If no variable matches the scope, it picks the first one that has generic scope that matches.
  4. We rank variables by name, meaning a variable with padding in its name will be preferred for the auto layout properties. One with gap or spacing in its name will be preferred for the gap properties. One with radii, cornerRadius or radius will be preferred for the radius properties


Learn more about variable scoping from the Figma docs here


How to use

1. Ensure you have access to variables in your local file or through a published team library. 

2. Select the elements on the canvas that you want to apply your variables

3. Run the plugin and choose which kind of variable you want to apply: Swap with variables by name or Apply matching variables (autofix)

4. Select the name of the library with the variables you want to apply. It automatically lists all shared libraries that are active. If your library doesn't show up, reload/reopen the Figma file. You can also pick "Local" if your collection is local to this file.

5. Select the name of the collection that has the variables you want to apply 

6. Choose where you want the variables to be applied 

  1. Selection (optimal performance) - If you‚Äôve selected specific elements on the Figma canvas to apply variables 
  2. Page - scans all elements on the current page and apply variables 
  3. Document - scans all elements on every page within the Figma File and applies variables (can be slow)

7. Check the status message at the bottom of the page 


Made with ‚ù§Ô∏è from your friends at Tokens Studio

accepted.name: Jan Six
accepted.description:
Product Design @ GitHub

github.com/six7

plugins.name: Component Page
plugins.description:
Create a component (like you would in Sketch) that lives on a dedicated "Components" page.

How it works:
1. Make a selection
2. Run the "Make Component" function in the plugin
3. A new Master Component will be created on the components page leaving an instance in place

You can even create multiple components from a selection all at once if you enable this option.

This plugin also has a secondary function called "Collect stray components". This function will find all master components outside of the dedicated components page, and move them to that page leaving an instance in place.

plugins.name: Rich Text Replacer
plugins.description:
This plugin is to help designers quickly replace all selected text layers with the same rich text. Currently supported format: regular, bold, italic, underline, list and link. For not available font family, it will use "Inter" instead.


How to use it

  1. Select text layers you'd like to replace
  2. Open the plugin "Rich Text Replacer > Start UI"
  3. Enter rich text in the textbox
  4. (Optional) You can check "Add Numbering Suffix" if you'd like to add a number to each text
  5. Click "Replace"
  6. Done


If there is a text layer you'd like to copy rich text from:

  1. Select a source text layer where you'd like to copy text
  2. Run the plugin "Rich Text Replacer > Copy Rich Text"
  3. Select target text layers or frames with target text layers in it
  4. Run the plugin "Rich Text Replacer > Paste to Text Layers"
  5. Done


Todo

  • Allow users to customize link style
  • Support more rich text format
plugins.tagline: Quickly replace your text with rich text

plugins.name: Figma to Tableau
plugins.description:
Design in Figma, Visualize in Tableau 

Save hours of work and hundreds of clicks for every new dashboard you create.


With one click, the plugin lets you turn your designs into fully functional Tableau Dashboards. You no longer have to rebuild your dashboard in Tableau and fight with containers or inconsistent floating elements.


üé• Watch the YouTube tutorial.

üëâ All details are available in the Plugin guide.

ü§Ø New Feature: Generate new dashboards in a single click!

üíµ Purchase a license


How it works:

Select a frame and click on export. As simple as that. Use Figma's capabilities and simplicity to create your dashboard UI and export it as a Tableau dashboard automatically.


New feature: Dashboard Generator üö®

We added a new Generate tab in the plugin that allows you to generate dashboards with containers, navigations buttons, logo, and more in a single click. You can select pre-defined layouts and save your design preferences. All generated dashboard are ready to be exported in Tableau!


Worksheets and existing Workbooks:

All Figma nodes starting with SHEET/ are automatically converted to a Tableau Worksheet.

If you don't input an existing Workbook, the generated Worksheets are simple bar charts connected to Sample Superstore. You can easily replace the dummy worksheets directly in Tableau.

If you input a Tableau Workbook, you can add your existing worksheets to your Figma design. The plugin automatically adds the correct worksheets to the Tableau dashboard during the export.


Export Options: 

You can choose to export your design as Tiled with Horizontal and Vertical Containers (only available if you use Auto-Layout in Figma), Floating elements, or as a Background Image (if you use shadows, gradients, rounded corners, or other functionality not available in Tableau).

Similarly, you can export the Text elements as Text objects in Tableau or Images if you use fonts unavailable in Tableau. You don't need to convert them; the plugin automatically does it.


Conversion:

  1. Auto Layout Frame -> Containers
  2. Nodes starting with SHEET/-> Worksheets
  3. Nodes starting with NAV/-> Navigation Buttons
  4. Image, Vector, and nodes starting with IMAGE/ -> Images
  5. Text -> Text
  6. Nodes starting with URL/-> Web Object
  7. Rectangles -> Blank


Visit the store to buy a license to use the tool.

Discover our other products and services at www.ladataviz.com.

accepted.name: Ladataviz
accepted.description: Data Visualization Studio

plugins.tagline: Export your Figma design into a fully functional Tableau Dashboard in one click

plugins.name: Export Code
plugins.description:
Export any vector asset to React or Vue components, Sass (or plain CSS), TailwindCSS, or an Android Archive (beta) or iOS Asset Catalog (beta). Edit the code templates to tailor the output to your preferences and development dependencies. For React and Vue, convert related assets to single components with custom props.


Note: Export Code is now completely free! A license key used to be required for unlimited exports, but now there are no restrictions. Read more about the plugin below.


Component Variants


With component exports (React and Vue), asset families can be combined into a single component with auto-created variants to pass as props. (e.g. up, right, down, and left arrow icons can be converted to a single Arrow component). There is no limit to the amount of variant types and setup is easy: all that‚Äôs required is a specific layer-naming scheme. Note that variants are based on a specific layer-naming scheme, not Figma‚Äôs official variant feature.


More


Customizable Templates


The exported code works entirely as-is without any modifications required. But if desired, you have the ability to customize the code output to your liking. The templates are powered by lodash‚Äôs templating system are extremely flexible.


More


Asset Manifest


Preview the exported assets‚Äô generated code, variant props, vector/raster check, and if they are a single color before downloading. Great for quality control when it comes to large asset sets like icons and perfect for quickly grabbing the code for a single asset.


Easy to Use


Programs like this can quickly become complicated to use. I‚Äôve done my best to structure it in a way to where a normal asset setup can be exported without having to make a bunch of structural changes. If you have an organized page of assets (like a collection of icons for example) chances are you will need to make minimal changes in order to export the assets.


The main prerequisite is that all of your assets need to be collected into a single Frame (or Component or Instance). You can then select this Frame and all of the child nodes (basically anything besides Text layers) will be exported as individual assets.


The best way to experiment is to just install the plugin and give it a go.


More details on how the plugin operates


Support


Running into trouble? Email: hey@oombla.com

accepted.name: Oombla
accepted.description: Oombla is a design token management company.

plugins.name: Figma to JSON
plugins.description:
Figma to JSON streamlines text extraction from your Figma designs into clean, structured JSON. By following a simple naming convention in the Layers panel (key=, value=, type=component), you can define text keys, multi-language values, and reusable components. Easily generate JSON and filter results for unique values or exclude components‚Äîall in just a few clicks!


üìù How to Use:

Name Text Layers Correctly:

1. Use this pattern:

key={text_name},value=,type=component

Example:

key=button_text_login,value=,type=component key=header_welcome,value=en=Welcome,th=‡∏¢‡∏¥‡∏ô‡∏î‡∏µ‡∏ï‡πâ‡∏≠‡∏ô‡∏£‡∏±‡∏ö

2. Define Values: If value= is left empty, the plugin will use the text from the design.

3. To store multiple languages: Example: value=en=Login,th=‡πÄ‡∏Ç‡πâ‡∏≤‡∏™‡∏π‡πà‡∏£‡∏∞‡∏ö‡∏ö

4. Mark Components (Optional): Add type=component to tag frequently used text. During JSON export, you can filter out components if needed.

5. Generate JSON: Click "Gen JSON" to create a JSON output based on your settings.

6. Copy JSON: Click "Copy JSON" to copy and use it in your project.


‚≠êÔ∏è Tips

- Always start with key

- After the key, you can put any variable.

- You can add values for variables next to the equal sign.

- If the variable next to the equal sign is empty. The value is the same as the text in Figma.

plugins.description:
Created by the ByteDance - Douyin FE and UED team. Official supports D2C with Semi UI, one-click conversion of design drafts into front-end codes.


Features

  1. Code Generation. Supports React + SCSS, React + Tailwind, React + @emotion/css, abstract code output JSON Schema
  2. Sandbox Preview. Supports preview code in CodeSandbox
  3. Component Support. Provides a set of out-of-the-box UI Kits that can be recognized by D2C and strictly aligned with the codeÔºàsemi-designÔºâ, and support marking third-party component libraries
  4. Image Export. Supports custom image upload interface
  5. Dev Mode Support. Supports developer to use plug-in transcoding without editing permission of design draft


How to use

  1. Install plugin
  2. Select a layer and start transcoding. (If you don't have editing permission, you can use the plugin in Dev Mode)
  3. Draft inspects
  4. Copy and paste, save code file to local or preview code in sandbox


Tips

  1. For better layout effect, please use Auto Layout
  2. The CSS class name in the code is named after the layer name
  3. Try to keep the layer structure as simple as possible to avoid overlapping layers


Advanced usage

  1. Mark component library. Use plug-ins to mark components or component sets to realize D2C identification of third-party component libraries.


Limitations

  1. Radial, Angular, Diamond Linear are not supported

plugins.name: Aidentic
plugins.description:
AIdentic is an AI design assistant that helps you improving the usability of your interfaces.


AIdentic analyses your mockups, suggests improvements on different elements such as text, images, fonts, colour palettes and so on, finally applies the improvements you want , automatically, directly on your file.


How it works?

  1. Install the plugin and create an account.
  2. Create a project and a test session: select the assets you want to test, from pages to single components, assign a name to the test sessions, link the figma url, and launch the test.
  3. Finally, check the outcome on AIdentic dashboard, reviewing the recommendations and applying the ones you want with the "fix" button.


We are a passionate team of UX, AI and tech enthusiasts, working hard to improve AIdentic with new features and capabilities, so your feedback is very precious to us!

You can write us at info@aidentic.io or or ping us on discord !


Thank you and happy UX!

The AIdentic team

https://aidentic.io

94797.description:
AIdentic is an AI design assistant that helps you improving the usability of your interfaces.


AIdentic analyses your mockups, suggests improvements on different elements such as text, images, fonts, colour palettes and so on, finally applies the improvements you want , automatically, directly on your file.


How it works?

  1. Install the plugin and create an account.
  2. Create a project and a test session: select the assets you want to test, from pages to single components, assign a name to the test sessions, link the figma url, and launch the test.
  3. Finally, check the outcome on AIdentic dashboard, reviewing the recommendations and applying the ones you want with the "fix" button.


We are a passionate team of UX, AI and tech enthusiasts, working hard to improve AIdentic with new features and capabilities, so your feedback is very precious to us!

You can write us at info@aidentic.io or or ping us on discord !


Thank you and happy UX!

The AIdentic team

https://aidentic.io
94797.release_notes: Small update to support latest changes made on Figma API.

plugins.name: Multiply
plugins.description:
Quickly multiply a layer in rows, columns or both (grid)


Features

  • Select amount of rows and columns
  • Select row and column gap (negative gap allowed)
  • After multiplication all new layers get selected so you can immediately make changes with "Smart Selection"
  • Supported in both Figma and FigJam



Notes

  • To avoid memory issues / freezing files, this plugin limits to maximum 2000 duplications or 10000 new (sub)layers
plugins.tagline: Quickly multiply a layer in rows, columns or both

plugins.name: Links manager üîó Edit links and url in any text layer
plugins.description:
Links are everywhere in UI design, right? Forget about clicking on text layers and getting tired selecting right text segment to edit link or fix its styles hundreds times. Let Links manager take care of it. All you need is link text and link URL all the rest will be done under the hood!


How to use?

  1. select layers (text, group, artboard, section) containing text layers with links/urls
  2. Links manager find all text layers with links and show them in easy-readable list
  3. add fixes and updates to links' text or url address
  4. apply changes
  5. ‚Üí links updated


With Links manager you get:

  1. locate any link on canvas
  2. edit links text or URL in couple clicks, no jewelry-accurate selection required
  3. bulk edit for large count of links
  4. wrap big text chunks for convenience
  5. clear all - terminate all links on current selection


Most common use cases

For web designers and ui designers

  1. easily apply right links to footers or other navigation or content sections
  2. keep links up to date on any text layer whether it will be documentation designs or just big text paragraphs
  3. help design fellows or developers have consistent understanding what is going on
  4. no worries pasting any texts from task trackers, any web app or website into your designs ‚Äî all unnecessary links will be easy to clean


For Figjam enjoyers

  1. building reusable template jam boards? keep all unique URLs up to date or modify them


For copywriters or content managers

  1. speed up copy delivery right inside Figma


For everyone

  1. time saver


Your touchpad, trackpad or mouse deserve a little brake!

üîë Get lifetime license key


Enjoy!

accepted.name: Ilia Kolebaev
accepted.description: Create & build

plugins.tagline: Get links' URL and text on all kinds of selection and any depth text layers nested.

plugins.name: Picky Font
plugins.description:
Sure, the default font picker is ok... but have you dreamed about a faster, better way to preview, sort, choose, try out, compare, and bookmark fonts? I know I did... well, dream no further! Try the Picky Font plugin today and become a Picky Fonter!


Features

  • Ultra-fast dynamic text preview to preview all your fonts at a glance
  • Search and bookmark filter for quick access and side-by-side comparisons
  • Instantly change any font with a single click in Picky Font
  • Works on low-end machines (tested on a Macbook Air 2011!)


Pricing

  • Free for 2 uses per document (No commitment, no sign-up necessary and use right away!)
  • If you like it, $10 (USD) for a lifetime license (limited to the first 100 customers, thanks for your support!) (payment through Gumroad for activation key)


About Us

We're a small two-person team passionate about design and making useful stuff. We strive to bring value quickly to creators like us!


Feedback

Contact us directly anytime at contact@leeen.app, or give us feedback on our feedback form about what you like, dislike, want to see, and any questions or issues you might have!


Privacy Policy and Terms of Use

Terms of Use and Privacy Policy

plugins.name: Microsoft Fluent UI Emoji Set by Iconduck
plugins.description:
This Figma Plugin powers the Microsoft Fluent UI Emoji Set open source library. It‚Äôs an emoji library designed for mobile, desktop, web and print.


There are 7,505 emojis included in this emoji library, all of which can be searched through and added to your designs.


Popular Microsoft Fluent UI Emoji Set emojis:

  • 3D emojis
  • Bear and animal emojis
  • Animal emojis
  • Facial expression emojis


Plugin features:

  • Drag and drop any emojis
  • Search through them instantly
  • Click any emoji to add it your design
  • View search history
  • View embed history


Coming soon:

  • Save your favorite Microsoft Fluent UI Emoji Set emojis

plugins.name: Darken Pages
plugins.description:
Deprecation Notice: Development on Darken Pages has been paused while I focus on other projects. Consider using @Dakshi Khatri's excellent Dark Matter plugin in the meantime. This plugin will continue to exist as is to avoid disrupting workflows, but future updates are unlikely.


Complete your Figma dark mode experience in one click with Darken Pages. Darken or lighten pages with customizable colors. This plugin is the perfect companion to Figma's newly released Dark and Light color themes.


Privacy & Network Access

Darken Pages is completely private. It runs locally in your file and does not make any network calls.


Open Source

Darken Pages is open source and contributions are welcome!

accepted.name: Aashrey Sharma
accepted.description: Senior UX Designer @ Epic Games
